title: A Tale of Two Economies Is Reshaping China’s Stock Market
summary: A tale of two economies is driving China’s stock market, prompting investors to raise bets on the beneficiaries of an industrial export boom at the expense of firms mired in a consumption slump.

title: AI chatbots as your investment advisor: The risks investors aren't seeing
summary: While AI chatbots are a great tool to learn concepts, narrow down choices or even discover options, the risk lies in treating recommendations as advice. Action-oriented money decision-making driven by AI can be risky

title: Union Budget 2026 to US Fed meet, Q3 results - Top five triggers that may dictate Indian stock market this week
summary: On Friday, both benchmark indices took a U-turn, slipping back into the red amid profit booking, after posting notable gains of around half a percent in the previous session.

title: Lawsuit Claims Meta Can See WhatsApp Chats in Breach of Privacy
summary: An international group of plaintiffs sued Meta Platforms, Inc. alleging that the company has made false claims about the privacy and security of its WhatsApp chat service.

title: US Fed set to keep rates steady as officials defend independence
summary: The US Federal Reserve is widely expected to keep interest rates unchanged when it meets in the coming week, holding firm despite President Donald Trump's pressure to slash levels as it guards against threats to its independence. - External pressure - The Fed meets eight times a year to consider interest rate levels, and Michael Pearce of Oxford Economics said the dilemma it faces has eased.

title: Are your WhatsApp messages really private? Fresh lawsuit challenges Meta's privacy claims
summary: Meta is being sued for allegedly misleading users about WhatsApp's encryption. An internation group of plaintiffs are arguing that the company can access private communications on its personal messaging platform.&nbsp;

title: ACME Group plans $1.4 bn green methanol plant in Odisha, inks agreement
summary: ACME Group has partnered with the Odisha government to invest $1.4 billion in a green methanol facility to meet the growing demand for sustainable maritime fuels.

title: 2026 may see more corrections. Focus on owning the correct business – & the 9 basic principles of investing in mid- and small-cap stocks
summary: Investors tend to get divided into two distinct sets during extended corrections. The first justify buying wrong stocks by describing themselves as “long-term investors”. The rest, genuine long-term investors, focus on the correct businesses. “Correct business”? Yes, one with a record of growth; which does not require frequent capital infusions; and where income is shared with minority investors. As geopolitics rock the global equity markets, here’s what investors must remember: Corrections are part of the market. They happened in 2024 and 2025, and will happen in 2026. Also, stock selection is the key given high valuations. Finally, manage behavioural risk. And that is something investors have to work out on their own.

title: Market cap of 9 of top-10 most valued firms plunges by Rs 2.51 lakh cr; RIL biggest laggard
summary: The combined market valuation of nine of the top-10 most valued firms slumped by Rs 2.51 lakh crore last week, with Reliance Industries taking the biggest hit, in line with a weak trend in equities.

title: Q3 earnings, Fed rate decision, Budget to steer Dalal Street this week
summary: Stock market is gearing up for an eventful week ahead where key triggers such as quarterly earnings from corporates, the US Fed interest rate decision and the upcoming Union Budget for 2026-27 would grab the limelight, analysts said.

title: How Mukul Agrawal tweaked his Rs 6,500-crore portfolio in Q3. Here’s all you need to know
summary: Ace investor Mukul Mahavir Agrawal reshuffled his Rs 6,500-crore equity portfolio in Q3, adding new names and adjusting stakes across several holdings. He entered stocks such as Hindustan Construction and Alcargo Logistics, increased exposure in Vasa Denticity and Vikran Engineering, and trimmed or exited positions in firms like Monolithisch, Pearl Global and Stanley Lifestyles. The moves reflect tactical repositioning after 2025’s sharp smallcap selloff.

title: ₹2.5 lakh crore! M-cap of 9 of India's 10 most valuable companies nosedive amid market bloodbath last week
summary: The combined market valuation of nine of the top-10 most valued firms, including Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank and Bharti Airtel, plunged by  ₹2,51,711.6 crore as Sensex tanked by over 2,000 points last week&nbsp;

title: Q3 results 2026: Axis Bank, L&T, Maruti Suzuki, Vodafone Idea, Paytm among companies to declare earnings next week
summary: Axis Bank, Larsen &amp; Toubro, Bharat Electronics, Vodafone Idea, Maruti Suzuki, ITC, Bajaj Auto, Paytm (One97 Communications), among marquee companies, to release Q3 results FY26 next week.

title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai sold over 30,000 shares in tech giant — Here's how much stake he still holds in Google
summary: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai sold around 30,521 shares in the tech giant last week, regulatory disclosures showed. Amid this, we take a look at how much stake the executive still holds in Google after his latest stake sale.

title: JioStar moves Supreme Court against CCI probe over alleged abuse of dominance in Kerala TV market
summary: JioStar has appealed a 3 December 2025 Kerala High Court order declining to stay the CCI probe and directing its completion within eight weeks. The Supreme Court will hear the matter on 27 January.

title: Upcoming IPOs: Shadowfax Technologies IPO listing, 5 SME issues scheduled for next week; check full list
summary: Apart from new SME IPOs, the market will also witness Shadowfax Technologies IPO listing in the mainboard segment on January 28.

title: Why a handful of expensive stocks are holding up in the correction
summary: Market corrections often punish expensive stocks, but some hold firm. Mint explains why select high-valuation companies stay resilient, backed by earnings visibility, structural tailwinds, and sustained investor conviction.

title: 8th Pay Commission: Employee organisation demands 3.25 fitment factor and 5% annual increment, says report
summary: FNPO has said that the previous pay commissions did not apply the fitment factor consistently at all levels, both by design and necessity. Therefore, it has sought fitment factors ranging from 3.0-3.25 for various central government employee levels

title: Gold, silver rates today: Metal prices continue to rise. Should you buy them before the Union Budget 2026?
summary: Spot silver jumped as much as 6.9% to $102.87 an ounce on Friday, taking year-to-date gains beyond 40%, after prices more than doubled in 2025. Gold also rose to a new all-time high, inching closer to the $5,000-an-ounce level.

title: JSW Steel sharpens expansion roadmap, eyes 56 mtpa capacity by FY31
summary: The move comes as steel prices show early signs of stabilizing and the company steps up raw material sourcing.

title: Stock market holiday: Will NSE and BSE remain closed on January 26 for Republic Day?
summary: Indian stock markets will be closed on Monday, January 26, for Republic Day, affecting trading across NSE, BSE and MCX. The closure marks the second market holiday of 2026. Trading will resume on Tuesday, January 27. For the rest of the year, exchanges will remain shut for 14 sessions, including Holi, Ram Navami, Diwali, Christmas and other national and regional observances.

title: Netflix CEO rejects Paramount's $108 billion offer for Warner Bros. amid Larry Ellison's backing — Here's why
summary: Netflix CEO rejected Paramount's offer and said that without Larry Ellison's financial backing via independent financing, there is allegedly no chance that the company will be able to pull off its acquisition funding. Here's what you need to know.&nbsp;

title: Why the rich still get systematic investing wrong
summary: The rationale for systematic investing is independent of portfolio size. Whether an investor has  ₹1,000 or several crores, market direction over the short or long term remains inherently uncertain.
